items: Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart and your kettlebells on the ground in front of you.
Bend down and grab the handles of the kettlebells with a neutral grip (palms facing each other).
Engage your core and lift the kettlebells off the ground.
Walk forward with small, controlled steps, keeping your shoulders back and your chest up.
Continue walking for a set distance or time, making sure to keep your core engaged and your posture upright.
When you’re finished, carefully lower the kettlebells back to the ground.
Enhances overall body coordination and balance
Targets multiple muscle groups including the glutes, hamstrings, quads, and abs
Can be modified for different fitness levels and abilities
Helps to prevent injury by improving joint stability and flexibility
Can be done with minimal equipment and space
Provides a full-body workout in a short amount of time
